title: ISCB 2018 Poster
description: A poster that my co workers while working at Cincinnat Children's Hospital Medical Center presented at the 2018 Intelligent Systems for Molecular Biology Conference.

title: Grace Hopper Celebration 2018
description: I got a scholarship from AnitaB.org to attend the Grace Hopper Celebration 2018 to support women in computing as a male ally.

title: Japan Trip
description: After my coop at Infinera, I traveled to Japan for a study tour with other UC students for two weeks. I had fully recovered from my injury and was ready for a new experience.

title: Accessibility Project
description: In fall of last year, I tore my meniscus doing everyday activities and needed to get surgery to repair the injury. This experience is me reflecting upon the experience and the effect it has had on me.

title: Bearcat Coders
description: For my first Honors Experience, I decided to take a larger involvement in the Association for Computing Machinery, Women's Chapter (ACM-W) and their program to help teach coding to local high school students at Hughes STEM High School.

title: Treachery
description: For my second honors experience, I worked with some of my fellow students to create a video game based on the board game Betrayal at House on the Hill.

title: Gateway to University Honors
description: As part of the honors curriculum, I had to take the gateway to honors course. This is the introductory course to University Honors Program at UC. To read more about my experience, click the link above.

title: Bark Bark
description: A location based social media app developed for software engineering class during summer 2018. This project is hosted on the domain https://bark.fyi

title: CCHMC Research
description: I worked with Dr. Porollo over the summer in 2017 on multiple research projects.

title: Bubble Shooter JS
description: For an independent project to learn how to use javascript (JS), I decided to make a bubble shooter game. It is a simple game where a player shoots bubbles in a browser JS game.

title: Medina
description: I attempted to use neural networks to create an AI to play a board game, Medina. This project is implemented using python and default graphics libraries.

title: Midi Improviser
description: As part of the Hackathon at UC in october 2016, I worked with Vuong Khuat, Wyatt French to create a program that would take a MIDI file and improvise. A MIDI file is a musical file that saves note sounds.

title: RET Project
description: Research Experience for Teacher (RET) projects done with Dr. Franco at the University of Cincinnati (UC). I helped develop coursework and perpare local high school teachers to teach cybersecurity the following years.

title: Player Count Message
description: A software modification for minecraft servers to allow players the ability to modify the server's look in the load screen.

title: Minecraft Playscape Project
description: Minecraft Playscape at The University of Cincinnati (UC) Arlitt. I designed software to track kids' actions in the Video Game Minecraft and later interpret the data as part of a research project. This project was later presented at the 2014 IT@UC conference.

title: Java Projects
description: Some projects of games I made using java to familiarize myself with the language.
